item.text: Now Joab son of Zeruiah realized that the king longed to see Absalom.

So <st data-num="03097" class="">Joab</st> <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> to <st data-num="08620" class="">Tekoa</st> and <st data-num="03947" class="">brought</st> from <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st> a <st data-num="02450" class="">wise</st> <st data-num="0802" class="">woman</st>. He <st data-num="0559 0413">told</st> her, “<st data-num="056 04994">Pretend to be in mourning</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="03847 04994">put on</st> <st data-num="0899" class="">garments</st> for <st data-num="060" class="">mourning</st>. <st data-num="0408" class="">Don’t</st> <st data-num="05480" class="">anoint</st> yourself with <st data-num="08081" class="">oil</st>. Instead, <st data-num="01961" class="">act</st> like a <st data-num="0802" class="">woman</st> who has been <st data-num="056" class="">mourning</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">for</st> the <st data-num="04191" class="">dead</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">for</st> <st data-num="07227" class="">some</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">time</st>.<n id="2" />
Go to the king and speak to him in the following fashion.” Then Joab told her what to say.
So the Tekoan woman went to the king. She bowed down with her face to the ground in deference to him and said, “Please help me, O king!”

The <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st> to her, “<st data-num="04100" class="">What</st> do you want?”<n id="1" /> She <st data-num="0559" class="">answered</st>, “<st data-num="0589" class="">I</st> am a <st data-num="061 0802 0490">widow</st>; my <st data-num="0376" class="">husband</st> <st data-num="04191" class="">is dead</st>.

Your <st data-num="08198" class="">servant</st><n id="1" /> has <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st>. When the <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> of them <st data-num="05327" class="">got into a fight</st> in the <st data-num="07704" class="">field</st>, <st data-num="0369" class="">there was no</st> one present who could <st data-num="05337 0996">intervene</st>. <st data-num="0259" class="">One</st> of them <st data-num="05221" class="">struck</st> the <st data-num="0259" class="">other</st> and <st data-num="04191" class="">killed</st> him.

Now the entire family has risen up against your servant, saying, ‘Turn over the one who struck down his brother, so that we can execute him and avenge the death of his brother whom he killed. In so doing we will also destroy the heir.’ They want to extinguish my remaining coal, leaving no one on the face of the earth to carry on the name of my husband.”
Then the king told the woman, “Go to your home. I will give instructions concerning your situation.”
The Tekoan woman said to the king, “My lord the king, let any blame fall on me and on the house of my father. But let the king and his throne be innocent!”
The king said, “Bring to me whoever speaks to you, and he won’t bother you again!”

She replied, “In that case, let the king invoke the name of the Lord your God so that the avenger of blood may not add to the killing! Then they will not destroy my son!” He replied, “As surely as the Lord lives, not a single hair of your son’s head will fall to the ground.”
Then the woman said, “Please permit your servant to speak to my lord the king about another matter.” He replied, “Tell me.”

The <st data-num="0802" class="">woman</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="04100" class="">Why</st> have you <st data-num="02803" class="">devised</st> something like <st data-num="02063" class="">this</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">against</st> <st data-num="0430" class="">God’s</st> <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st>? When the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="01696" class="">speaks</st> in <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">fashion</st>, he makes himself <st data-num="0818" class="">guilty</st>, for the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> has <st data-num="01115" class="">not</st> <st data-num="07725" class="">brought back</st> the one he has <st data-num="05080" class="">banished</st>.

<st data-num="03588" class="">Certainly</st> we <st data-num="04191" class="">must</st> <st data-num="04191" class="">die</st>, and are like <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st> <st data-num="05064" class="">spilled</st> on the <st data-num="0776" class="">ground</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">cannot</st> be <st data-num="0622" class="">gathered up</st> again. But <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> does <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05375" class="">take away</st> <st data-num="05315" class="">life</st>; instead he <st data-num="02803" class="">devises</st> <st data-num="04284" class="">ways</st> for the <st data-num="05080" class="">banished</st> to <st data-num="01115 05080 04480">be restored</st>.<n id="1" />

I have <st data-num="06258 0834">now</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">come</st> to <st data-num="01696" class="">speak</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">with</st> my <st data-num="0113" class="">lord</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> about <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">matter</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">because</st> the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> have <st data-num="03372" class="">made</st> me <st data-num="03372" class="">fearful</st>.<n id="1" /> But your <st data-num="08198" class="">servant</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, ‘I will <st data-num="01696 04994">speak</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st>! <st data-num="0194" class="">Perhaps</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> will <st data-num="06213" class="">do</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">what</st> his <st data-num="0519" class="">female servant</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="01697" class="">asks</st>.

<st data-num="03588" class="">Yes</st>!<n id="1" /> The <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> may<n id="2" /> <st data-num="08085" class="">listen</st> and <st data-num="05337" class="">deliver</st> his <st data-num="0519" class="">female servant</st><n id="3" /> from the <st data-num="03709" class="">hand</st> of the <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> who seeks to <st data-num="08045" class="">remove</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="03162" class="">both</st> me and my <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> from the <st data-num="05159" class="">inheritance</st> <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> has given us!’<n id="5" />

So your servant said, ‘May the word of my lord the king be my security, for my lord the king is like the angel of God when it comes to deciding between right and wrong! May the Lord your God be with you!’”
Then the king replied to the woman, “Don’t hide any information from me when I question you.” The woman said, “Let my lord the king speak.”

The <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “Did <st data-num="03027 03097">Joab</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">put</st> you <st data-num="0854" class="">up</st> to <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> of <st data-num="02063" class="">this</st>?”<n id="1" /> The <st data-num="0802" class="">woman</st> <st data-num="06030 0559">answered</st>, “As surely as <st data-num="05315" class="">you</st> <st data-num="02416" class="">live</st>, my <st data-num="0113" class="">lord</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st>, <st data-num="0786" class="">there is</st> <st data-num="0518" class="">no</st> <st data-num="03231 08041">deviation to</st> the <st data-num="03231" class="">right</st> or to the <st data-num="08041" class="">left</st> from <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> my <st data-num="0113" class="">lord</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> has <st data-num="01696" class="">said</st>. <st data-num="03588" class="">For</st> your <st data-num="05650" class="">servant</st> <st data-num="03097" class="">Joab</st> <st data-num="01931 06680">gave</st> me <st data-num="01931 06680">instructions</st>. <st data-num="01931" class="">He</st> has <st data-num="07760" class="">put</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="0428" class="">these</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">words</st> in your <st data-num="08198" class="">servant’s</st> <st data-num="06310" class="">mouth</st>.
Your servant Joab did this so as to change this situation. But my lord has wisdom like that of the angel of God, and knows everything that is happening in the land.”
Then the king said to Joab, “All right! I will do this thing. Go and bring back the young man Absalom!”

Then Joab bowed down with his face toward the ground and thanked the king. Joab said, “Today your servant knows that I have found favor in your sight, my lord the king, because the king has granted the request of your servant!”
So Joab got up and went to Geshur and brought Absalom back to Jerusalem.
But the king said, “Let him go over to his own house. He may not see my face.” So Absalom went over to his own house; he did not see the king’s face.
Now in all Israel everyone acknowledged that there was no man as handsome as Absalom. From the soles of his feet to the top of his head he was perfect in appearance.

When he would <st data-num="01548" class="">shave</st> his <st data-num="07218" class="">head</st>—at the <st data-num="07093" class="">end</st> of <st data-num="03117" class="">every</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">year</st> he <st data-num="01961" class="">used</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">to</st> <st data-num="01548" class="">shave</st> his head, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> it <st data-num="03513" class="">grew</st> <st data-num="05921">too</st> <st data-num="03513" class="">long</st><n id="1" /> and he would <st data-num="01548" class="">shave</st> it—he used to <st data-num="08254" class="">weigh</st> the <st data-num="08181" class="">hair</st> of his <st data-num="07218" class="">head</st> at <st data-num="03967 08255">three pounds</st><n id="2" /> according to the <st data-num="04428" class="">king’s</st> <st data-num="068" class="">weight</st>.
Absalom had three sons and one daughter, whose name was Tamar. She was a very attractive woman.
Absalom lived in Jerusalem for two years without seeing the king’s face.

Then <st data-num="053" class="">Absalom</st> <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> a message <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="03097" class="">Joab</st> asking him to <st data-num="07971" class="">send</st> him <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st>, but Joab<n id="1" /> was <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="014" class="">willing</st> to <st data-num="0935" class="">come</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> him. So he <st data-num="07971 05750">sent</st> a <st data-num="08145" class="">second</st> message to him, but he still <st data-num="014" class="">was</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="014" class="">willing</st> to <st data-num="0935" class="">come</st>.
So he said to his servants, “Look, Joab has a portion of field adjacent to mine and he has some barley there. Go and set it on fire.” So Absalom’s servants set Joab’s portion of the field on fire.
Then Joab got up and came to Absalom’s house. He said to him, “Why did your servants set my portion of field on fire?”

Absalom said to Joab, “Look, I sent a message to you saying, ‘Come here so that I can send you to the king with this message: “Why have I come from Geshur? It would be better for me if I were still there.”’ Let me now see the face of the king. If I am at fault, let him put me to death!”
So Joab went to the king and informed him. The king summoned Absalom, and he came to the king. Absalom bowed down before the king with his face toward the ground and the king kissed him.
